node.title: 'Daigou is dying', but Australian products remain popular in China despite trade tensions
node.alt: Jack Ma dresses as Michael Jackson
node.description: The world's largest online shopping festival sets a new sales record, with Australian products playing a big part, butÂ year-on-year growth falls to its slowest since the event began.
node.content:
["The world's largest online shopping festival has set a new sales record with Australia businesses playing a big part.", "This year's 11.11 global shopping festival, known as the Singles' Day event in China, generated $115.8 billion\u00a0in sales during Chinese technology-giant\u00a0Alibaba's\u00a011-day campaign.", "But year-on-year sales growth\u00a0fell to 8.5 per cent \u2014 its slowest since the festival began in 2009.", "Millions of Chinese consumers, who had piled up products in their digital carts across almost\u00a0500\u00a0online shopping platforms, rushed to check out their orders as the clock ticked past\u00a0midnight into\u00a0Thursday,\u00a0the main day of the event.", "\"This year\u2019s festival is one of the largest opportunities for Australian businesses to reach consumers in China,\u201d says Maggie Zhou, managing director of Alibaba Group, Australia and New Zealand.", "\"With the festival now in its 13th year \u2026\u00a0more than 900 million consumers across China and more than 290,000 merchants and brands join in the campaign.\"", "Despite the huge number of shoppers, there were none of the usual\u00a0rolling tallies or triumphant comments by executives from major platforms as the e-commerce sector continues to maintain\u00a0a lower profile amid a government crackdown on platforms like\u00a0Alibaba.", "
Australian\u00a0products as popular as ever
", "", "
Many major Australian brands are popular with daigou shoppers.(ABC News graphic: Jarrod Fankhauser)
", "Health supplements, adult milk powder, infant and toddler nutrition, and emulsion and powdered drink mixes were the top five Australian product categories sought by Chinese consumers.", "But even before Singles' Day, Australian products were already the most popular among foreign brands on Alibaba's e-commerce platforms in September.", "It was\u00a0followed by the United States, Japan, Germany and Canada.", "The Common Good Group (TCGG), a company that helps Australian brands\u00a0reach Chinese consumers via China's cross border e-commerce\u00a0platforms, said\u00a0vitamins and minerals made up\u00a0a major chunk of Alibaba's sales figures during Singles' Day.", "Similarly, Australian beauty supplements, probiotics and products for gut and immune health were also extremely popular\u00a0in China.\u00a0", "\"There's obvious\u00a0issues with Australia and China from a political perspective,\"\u00a0Jeremy Hunt, TCGG's CEO and daigou expert, told the ABC.", "\"But at a person-to-person level, Chinese consumers don't care where their\u00a0[products] come from, because the products themselves have good benefits.\"", "", "
Jeremy Hunt says supply\u00a0chains into China have\u00a0changed significantly during the pandemic.(Supplied)
", "Mr Hunt said Australian companies selling to China had seen a huge shift in their sales channels\u00a0due to\u00a0the very limited number of\u00a0planes and ships going into China during the COVID-19 pandemic.\u00a0", "\"What that meant was brands had to change how they targeted and sold their products,\" Mr Hunt said.", "\"Instead of going through the retail channel or daigou channel, they had to go direct to China.\"", "Daigou shoppers, who buy domestic products in Australia on behalf of their customers in China, had created\u00a0a multi-billion-dollar economic backchannel\u00a0over recent years, integrating retail, marketing, and logistics services across Australia.", "The\u00a0controversial practice created huge awareness of Australian brands\u00a0in China, which Mr Hunt said had led to many Australian\u00a0companies opting to open official stores on Chinese e-commerce platforms.", "", "
Empty baby formula shelves in Australian supermarkets have been a common sight over recent years but that is changing.(ABC News: Brian Hurst )
", "He said it meant daigou shoppers were no longer buying from outlets like Chemist Warehouse and Woolworths.", "Instead, they were now promoting\u00a0products to Chinese customers, who buy from Chinese platforms that feature Australian goods.", "\"But the marketing to domestic Chinese consumers and Australian-based daigou was still very important,\" Mr Hunt said.", "\"Consumers in China still believe that Australian brands offer a high efficacy and highly credentialled product and brand versus the Chinese brand.", "\"So people are still choosing to buy Australian brands.\"", "
Direct sales replacing daigou personal shoppers
", "", "
About a third of daigou specialty shops have closed during the coronavirus pandemic due to lack of business last year.
", "There are more than 2,000 Australian companies and 700 New Zealand businesses with official online stores on Alibaba.", "And as brands\u00a0boost their direct sales\u00a0to Chinese consumers, it's seen the demand for daigou shoppers plummet.", "Former full-time daigou shopper Christine Liu has gone from selling at least 300 tins of baby formula a month before the pandemic, to selling almost zero tins in October.", "It's forced her to find new work in order to survive.", "\"You can say that daigou is dying, and these two years have been extremely difficult for the industry,\" the 29-year-old\u00a0told the ABC.", "\"Lots of Australian brands now have their own online stores and warehouses in China, and they are capable of providing record-low prices for Chinese customers.\"", "", "
Ms Liu had to find another\u00a0job due to a lack of orders for her daigou business.(Supplied: Christine Liu)
", "Ms Liu has been only serving regular customers who have strong connections with her on Chinese social media platform WeChat.", "She said\u00a0there were other \"inevitable\" factors that created challenges for daigou, such as customers waiting months for their parcels\u00a0after they had been sent from Australia.", "With the delay in parcels clearing Chinese ports, even many of her regular customers have lost confidence.", "\"And the media in China is really promoting the concept that Chinese people should buy Chinese products,\u00a0instead of buying imported goods.\"", "She also said at least 50 per cent of her customers had cancelled their regular orders and turned to domestic brands in China, because of fears of contracting COVID-19 from parcels.", "China has urged its ports to minimise the risk of coronavirus transmission after it reportedly found cases linked to contaminated frozen food packaging from overseas, which has hampered\u00a0public\u00a0confidence in foreign products.", "Even though there was still demand\u00a0from Chinese consumers, the lockdowns in Melbourne and Sydney, as well as Australia's border restrictions that blocked tourists and international students, have led to the\u00a0industry lacking manpower.", "\"Daigou has been\u00a0compromised by all of these factors,\" Ms Liu\u00a0said.", "
China isn't the only lucrative market
", "", "
Commodities including barley, wine and meat have been casualties of trade tensions with China.(News Video)
", "As the Australia-China relationship has worsened, Beijing's trade restrictions on Australian goods has\u00a0seen exporters find alternative markets.\u00a0", "Despite the high reputation of Australian products and the revenue associated with selling\u00a0in the Chinese markets, conflicts between Canberra and Beijing have made it hard to find social media influencers to promote\u00a0Australian goods.", "\"So they were more aware that they should talk less about Australia and more about the product, function and performance.\"", "", "
Mr Fu says other emerging markets in Asia are as important as the Chinese market for Australia.(Supplied)
", "Jerome Fu, global marketing and e-commerce manager at vitamin and supplement supplier\u00a0Australian NaturalCare,\u00a0said his company's pre-sales for Singles' Day started in November, and included\u00a0promotions to live-streaming audiences on Chinese social media.", "But he told the ABC the company was looking at other emerging markets in the Asia Pacific region.", "\"Chinese technology giants such as Alibaba and JD.com\u00a0are also building established online shopping platforms in those markets.", "\"These countries also have very good potential.\""]
